33#include <sys/cdefs.h>
34__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: drm_ioctl.c,v 1.11 2018/09/14 05:31:14 maya Exp $");

36#include <drm/drmP.h>
37#include <drm/drm_core.h>
38#include "drm_legacy.h"
39#include "drm_internal.h"
40#include "drm_crtc_internal.h"
41
42#include <linux/pci.h>
43#include <linux/export.h>
44
45static int drm_version(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
46 struct drm_file *file_priv);
47
48/*
49 * Get the bus id.
50 *
51 * \param inode device inode.
52 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
53 * \param cmd command.
54 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_unique structure.
55 * \return zero on success or a negative number on failure.
56 *
57 * Copies the bus id from drm_device::unique into user space.
58 */
59static int drm_getunique(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
60 struct drm_file *file_priv)
61{
62 struct drm_unique *u = data;
63 struct drm_master *master = file_priv->master;
64
65 if (u->unique_len >= master->unique_len) {
66 if (copy_to_user(u->unique, master->unique, master->unique_len))
67 return -EFAULT;
68 }
69 u->unique_len = master->unique_len;
70
71 return 0;
72}
73
74static void
75drm_unset_busid(struct drm_device *dev,
76 struct drm_master *master)
77{
78 kfree(master->unique);
79 master->unique = NULL;
80 master->unique_len = 0;
81}
82
83/*
84 * Set the bus id.
85 *
86 * \param inode device inode.
87 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
88 * \param cmd command.
89 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_unique structure.
90 * \return zero on success or a negative number on failure.
91 *
92 * Copies the bus id from userspace into drm_device::unique, and verifies that
93 * it matches the device this DRM is attached to (EINVAL otherwise). Deprecated
94 * in interface version 1.1 and will return EBUSY when setversion has requested
95 * version 1.1 or greater. Also note that KMS is all version 1.1 and later and
96 * UMS was only ever supported on pci devices.
97 */
98static int drm_setunique(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
99 struct drm_file *file_priv)
100{
101 struct drm_unique *u = data;
102 struct drm_master *master = file_priv->master;
103 int ret;
104
105 if (master->unique_len || master->unique)
106 return -EBUSY;
107
108 if (!u->unique_len || u->unique_len > 1024)
109 return -EINVAL;
110
111 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_MODESET))
112 return 0;
113
114 if (WARN_ON(!dev->pdev))
115 return -EINVAL;
116
117 if (!dev->driver->set_unique)
118 return -ENODEV;
119
120 ret = dev->driver->set_unique(dev, master, u);
121 if (ret)
122 goto err;
123
124 return 0;
125
126err:
127 drm_unset_busid(dev, master);
128 return ret;
129}
130
131static int drm_set_busid(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv)
132{
133 struct drm_master *master = file_priv->master;
134 int ret;
135
136 if (master->unique != NULL)
137 drm_unset_busid(dev, master);
138
139 if (dev->driver->set_busid) {
140 ret = dev->driver->set_busid(dev, master);
141 if (ret) {
142 drm_unset_busid(dev, master);
143 return ret;
144 }
145 } else {
146 if (WARN(dev->unique == NULL,
147 "No drm_driver.set_busid() implementation provided by "
148 "%ps. Use drm_dev_set_unique() to set the unique "
149 "name explicitly.", dev->driver))
150 return -EINVAL;
151
152 master->unique = kstrdup(dev->unique, GFP_KERNEL);
153 if (master->unique)
154 master->unique_len = strlen(dev->unique);
155 }
156
157 return 0;
158}
159
160/*
161 * Get a mapping information.
162 *
163 * \param inode device inode.
164 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
165 * \param cmd command.
166 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_map structure.
167 *
168 * \return zero on success or a negative number on failure.
169 *
170 * Searches for the mapping with the specified offset and copies its information
171 * into userspace
172 */
173static int drm_getmap(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
174 struct drm_file *file_priv)
175{
176 struct drm_map *map = data;
177 struct drm_map_list *r_list = NULL;
178 struct list_head *list;
179 int idx;
180 int i;
181
182 idx = map->offset;
183 if (idx < 0)
184 return -EINVAL;
185
186 i = 0;
187 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
188 list_for_each(list, &dev->maplist) {
189 if (i == idx) {
190 r_list = list_entry(list, struct drm_map_list, head);
191 break;
192 }
193 i++;
194 }
195 if (!r_list || !r_list->map) {
196 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
197 return -EINVAL;
198 }
199
200 map->offset = r_list->map->offset;
201 map->size = r_list->map->size;
202 map->type = r_list->map->type;
203 map->flags = r_list->map->flags;
204 map->handle = (void *)(unsigned long) r_list->user_token;
205 map->mtrr = arch_phys_wc_index(r_list->map->mtrr);
206
207 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
208
209 return 0;
210}
211
212/*
213 * Get client information.
214 *
215 * \param inode device inode.
216 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
217 * \param cmd command.
218 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_client structure.
219 *
220 * \return zero on success or a negative number on failure.
221 *
222 * Searches for the client with the specified index and copies its information
223 * into userspace
224 */
225static int drm_getclient(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
226 struct drm_file *file_priv)
227{
228 struct drm_client *client = data;
229
230 /*
231 * Hollowed-out getclient ioctl to keep some dead old drm tests/tools
232 * not breaking completely. Userspace tools stop enumerating one they
233 * get -EINVAL, hence this is the return value we need to hand back for
234 * no clients tracked.
235 *
236 * Unfortunately some clients (*cough* libva *cough*) use this in a fun
237 * attempt to figure out whether they're authenticated or not. Since
238 * that's the only thing they care about, give it to the directly
239 * instead of walking one giant list.
240 */
241 if (client->idx == 0) {
242 client->auth = file_priv->authenticated;
243#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX Too scary to contemplate. */
244 client->pid = curproc->p_pid;
245 client->uid = kauth_cred_geteuid(curproc->p_cred);
246#else
247 client->pid = pid_vnr(file_priv->pid);
248 client->uid = from_kuid_munged(current_user_ns(),
249 file_priv->uid);
250#endif
251 client->magic = 0;
252 client->iocs = 0;
253
254 return 0;
255 } else {
256 return -EINVAL;
257 }
258}
259
260/*
261 * Get statistics information.
262 *
263 * \param inode device inode.
264 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
265 * \param cmd command.
266 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_stats structure.
267 *
268 * \return zero on success or a negative number on failure.
269 */
270static int drm_getstats(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
271 struct drm_file *file_priv)
272{
273 struct drm_stats *stats = data;
274
275 /* Clear stats to prevent userspace from eating its stack garbage. */
276 memset(stats, 0, sizeof(*stats));
277
278 return 0;
279}
280
281/*
282 * Get device/driver capabilities
283 */
284static int drm_getcap(struct drm_device *dev, void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv)
285{
286 struct drm_get_cap *req = data;
287
288 req->value = 0;
289 switch (req->capability) {
290 case DRM_CAP_DUMB_BUFFER:
291 if (dev->driver->dumb_create)
292 req->value = 1;
293 break;
294 case DRM_CAP_VBLANK_HIGH_CRTC:
295 req->value = 1;
296 break;
297 case DRM_CAP_DUMB_PREFERRED_DEPTH:
298 req->value = dev->mode_config.preferred_depth;
299 break;
300 case DRM_CAP_DUMB_PREFER_SHADOW:
301 req->value = dev->mode_config.prefer_shadow;
302 break;
303 case DRM_CAP_PRIME:
304 req->value |= dev->driver->prime_fd_to_handle ? DRM_PRIME_CAP_IMPORT : 0;
305 req->value |= dev->driver->prime_handle_to_fd ? DRM_PRIME_CAP_EXPORT : 0;
306 break;
307 case DRM_CAP_TIMESTAMP_MONOTONIC:
308 req->value = drm_timestamp_monotonic;
309 break;
310 case DRM_CAP_ASYNC_PAGE_FLIP:
311 req->value = dev->mode_config.async_page_flip;
312 break;
313 case DRM_CAP_CURSOR_WIDTH:
314 if (dev->mode_config.cursor_width)
315 req->value = dev->mode_config.cursor_width;
316 else
317 req->value = 64;
318 break;
319 case DRM_CAP_CURSOR_HEIGHT:
320 if (dev->mode_config.cursor_height)
321 req->value = dev->mode_config.cursor_height;
322 else
323 req->value = 64;
324 break;
325 case DRM_CAP_ADDFB2_MODIFIERS:
326 req->value = dev->mode_config.allow_fb_modifiers;
327 break;
328 default:
329 return -EINVAL;
330 }
331 return 0;
332}
333
334/*
335 * Set device/driver capabilities
336 */
337static int
338drm_setclientcap(struct drm_device *dev, void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv)
339{
340 struct drm_set_client_cap *req = data;
341
342 switch (req->capability) {
343 case DRM_CLIENT_CAP_STEREO_3D:
344 if (req->value > 1)
345 return -EINVAL;
346 file_priv->stereo_allowed = req->value;
347 break;
348 case DRM_CLIENT_CAP_UNIVERSAL_PLANES:
349 if (req->value > 1)
350 return -EINVAL;
351 file_priv->universal_planes = req->value;
352 break;
353 case DRM_CLIENT_CAP_ATOMIC:
354 if (!drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_ATOMIC))
355 return -EINVAL;
356 if (req->value > 1)
357 return -EINVAL;
358 file_priv->atomic = req->value;
359 file_priv->universal_planes = req->value;
360 break;
361 default:
362 return -EINVAL;
363 }
364
365 return 0;
366}
367
368/*
369 * Setversion ioctl.
370 *
371 * \param inode device inode.
372 * \param file_priv DRM file private.
373 * \param cmd command.
374 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_lock structure.
375 * \return zero on success or negative number on failure.
376 *
377 * Sets the requested interface version
378 */
379static int drm_setversion(struct drm_device *dev, void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv)
380{
381 struct drm_set_version *sv = data;
382 int if_version, retcode = 0;
383
384 if (sv->drm_di_major != -1) {
385 if (sv->drm_di_major != DRM_IF_MAJOR ||
386 sv->drm_di_minor < 0 || sv->drm_di_minor > DRM_IF_MINOR) {
387 retcode = -EINVAL;
388 goto done;
389 }
390 if_version = DRM_IF_VERSION(sv->drm_di_major,
391 sv->drm_di_minor);
392 dev->if_version = max(if_version, dev->if_version);
393 if (sv->drm_di_minor >= 1) {
394 /*
395 * Version 1.1 includes tying of DRM to specific device
396 * Version 1.4 has proper PCI domain support
397 */
398 retcode = drm_set_busid(dev, file_priv);
399 if (retcode)
400 goto done;
401 }
402 }
403
404 if (sv->drm_dd_major != -1) {
405 if (sv->drm_dd_major != dev->driver->major ||
406 sv->drm_dd_minor < 0 || sv->drm_dd_minor >
407 dev->driver->minor) {
408 retcode = -EINVAL;
409 goto done;
410 }
411 }
412
413done:
414 sv->drm_di_major = DRM_IF_MAJOR;
415 sv->drm_di_minor = DRM_IF_MINOR;
416 sv->drm_dd_major = dev->driver->major;
417 sv->drm_dd_minor = dev->driver->minor;
418
419 return retcode;
420}
421
422/**
423 * drm_noop - DRM no-op ioctl implemntation
424 * @dev: DRM device for the ioctl
425 * @data: data pointer for the ioctl
426 * @file_priv: DRM file for the ioctl call
427 *
428 * This no-op implementation for drm ioctls is useful for deprecated
429 * functionality where we can't return a failure code because existing userspace
430 * checks the result of the ioctl, but doesn't care about the action.
431 *
432 * Always returns successfully with 0.
433 */
434int drm_noop(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
435 struct drm_file *file_priv)
436{
437 DRM_DEBUG("\n");
438 return 0;
439}
440EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_noop);
441
442/**
443 * drm_invalid_op - DRM invalid ioctl implemntation
444 * @dev: DRM device for the ioctl
445 * @data: data pointer for the ioctl
446 * @file_priv: DRM file for the ioctl call
447 *
448 * This no-op implementation for drm ioctls is useful for deprecated
449 * functionality where we really don't want to allow userspace to call the ioctl
450 * any more. This is the case for old ums interfaces for drivers that
451 * transitioned to kms gradually and so kept the old legacy tables around. This
452 * only applies to radeon and i915 kms drivers, other drivers shouldn't need to
453 * use this function.
454 *
455 * Always fails with a return value of -EINVAL.
456 */
457int drm_invalid_op(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
458 struct drm_file *file_priv)
459{
460 return -EINVAL;
461}
462EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_invalid_op);
463
464/*
465 * Copy and IOCTL return string to user space
466 */
467static int drm_copy_field(char __user *buf, size_t *buf_len, const char *value)
468{
469 int len;
470
471 /* don't overflow userbuf */
472 len = strlen(value);
473 if (len > *buf_len)
474 len = *buf_len;
475
476 /* let userspace know exact length of driver value (which could be
477 * larger than the userspace-supplied buffer) */
478 *buf_len = strlen(value);
479
480 /* finally, try filling in the userbuf */
481 if (len && buf)
482 if (copy_to_user(buf, value, len))
483 return -EFAULT;
484 return 0;
485}
486
487/*
488 * Get version information
489 *
490 * \param inode device inode.
491 * \param filp file pointer.
492 * \param cmd command.
493 * \param arg user argument, pointing to a drm_version structure.
494 * \return zero on success or negative number on failure.
495 *
496 * Fills in the version information in \p arg.
497 */
498static int drm_version(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
499 struct drm_file *file_priv)
500{
501 struct drm_version *version = data;
502 int err;
503
504 version->version_major = dev->driver->major;
505 version->version_minor = dev->driver->minor;
506 version->version_patchlevel = dev->driver->patchlevel;
507 err = drm_copy_field(version->name, &version->name_len,
508 dev->driver->name);
509 if (!err)
510 err = drm_copy_field(version->date, &version->date_len,
511 dev->driver->date);
512 if (!err)
513 err = drm_copy_field(version->desc, &version->desc_len,
514 dev->driver->desc);
515
516 return err;
517}
518
519/*
520 * drm_ioctl_permit - Check ioctl permissions against caller
521 *
522 * @flags: ioctl permission flags.
523 * @file_priv: Pointer to struct drm_file identifying the caller.
524 *
525 * Checks whether the caller is allowed to run an ioctl with the
526 * indicated permissions. If so, returns zero. Otherwise returns an
527 * error code suitable for ioctl return.
528 */
529int drm_ioctl_permit(u32 flags, struct drm_file *file_priv)
530{
531 /* ROOT_ONLY is only for CAP_SYS_ADMIN */
532#ifdef __NetBSD__
533 if (unlikely((flags & DRM_ROOT_ONLY) && !DRM_SUSER()))
534#else
535 if (unlikely((flags & DRM_ROOT_ONLY) && !capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN)))
536#endif
537 return -EACCES;
538
539 /* AUTH is only for authenticated or render client */
540 if (unlikely((flags & DRM_AUTH) && !drm_is_render_client(file_priv) &&
541 !file_priv->authenticated))
542 return -EACCES;
543
544 /* MASTER is only for master or control clients */
545 if (unlikely((flags & DRM_MASTER) && !file_priv->is_master &&
546 !drm_is_control_client(file_priv)))
547 return -EACCES;
548
549 /* Control clients must be explicitly allowed */
550 if (unlikely(!(flags & DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW) &&
551 drm_is_control_client(file_priv)))
552 return -EACCES;
553
554 /* Render clients must be explicitly allowed */
555 if (unlikely(!(flags & DRM_RENDER_ALLOW) &&
556 drm_is_render_client(file_priv)))
557 return -EACCES;
558
559 return 0;
560}
561EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_ioctl_permit);
562
563#define DRM_IOCTL_DEF(ioctl, _func, _flags) \
564 [DRM_IOCTL_NR(ioctl)] = { \
565 .cmd = ioctl, \
566 .func = _func, \
567 .flags = _flags, \
568 .name = #ioctl \
569 }
570
571/* Ioctl table */
572static const struct drm_ioctl_desc drm_ioctls[] = {
573 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_VERSION, drm_version,
574 DRM_UNLOCKED|DRM_RENDER_ALLOW|DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW),
575 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_UNIQUE, drm_getunique, 0),
576 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_MAGIC, drm_getmagic, 0),
577 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_IRQ_BUSID, drm_irq_by_busid, DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
578 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_MAP, drm_getmap, DRM_UNLOCKED),
579 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_CLIENT, drm_getclient, DRM_UNLOCKED),
580 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_STATS, drm_getstats, DRM_UNLOCKED),
581 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_CAP, drm_getcap, DRM_UNLOCKED|DRM_RENDER_ALLOW),
582 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SET_CLIENT_CAP, drm_setclientcap, 0),
583 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SET_VERSION, drm_setversion, DRM_MASTER),
584
585 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SET_UNIQUE, drm_setunique, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
586 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_BLOCK, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
587 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_UNBLOCK, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
588 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AUTH_MAGIC, drm_authmagic, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER),
589
590 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_ADD_MAP, drm_legacy_addmap_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
591 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_RM_MAP, drm_legacy_rmmap_ioctl, DRM_AUTH),
592
593 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SET_SAREA_CTX, drm_legacy_setsareactx, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
594 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_SAREA_CTX, drm_legacy_getsareactx, DRM_AUTH),
595
596 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SET_MASTER, drm_setmaster_ioctl, DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
597 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_DROP_MASTER, drm_dropmaster_ioctl, DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
598
599 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_ADD_CTX, drm_legacy_addctx, DRM_AUTH|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
600 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_RM_CTX, drm_legacy_rmctx, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
601 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MOD_CTX, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
602 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GET_CTX, drm_legacy_getctx, DRM_AUTH),
603 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SWITCH_CTX, drm_legacy_switchctx, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
604 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_NEW_CTX, drm_legacy_newctx, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
605 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_RES_CTX, drm_legacy_resctx, DRM_AUTH),
606
607 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_ADD_DRAW, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
608 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_RM_DRAW, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
609
610 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_LOCK, drm_legacy_lock, DRM_AUTH),
611 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_UNLOCK, drm_legacy_unlock, DRM_AUTH),
612
613 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_FINISH, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH),
614
615 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_ADD_BUFS, drm_legacy_addbufs, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
616 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MARK_BUFS, drm_legacy_markbufs, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
617 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_INFO_BUFS, drm_legacy_infobufs, DRM_AUTH),
618 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MAP_BUFS, drm_legacy_mapbufs, DRM_AUTH),
619 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_FREE_BUFS, drm_legacy_freebufs, DRM_AUTH),
620 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_DMA, drm_legacy_dma_ioctl, DRM_AUTH),
621
622 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_CONTROL, drm_control, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
623
624#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_AGP)
625 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_ACQUIRE, drm_agp_acquire_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
626 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_RELEASE, drm_agp_release_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
627 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_ENABLE, drm_agp_enable_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
628 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_INFO, drm_agp_info_ioctl, DRM_AUTH),
629 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_ALLOC, drm_agp_alloc_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
630 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_FREE, drm_agp_free_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
631 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_BIND, drm_agp_bind_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
632 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_AGP_UNBIND, drm_agp_unbind_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
633#endif
634
635 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SG_ALLOC, drm_legacy_sg_alloc, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
636 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_SG_FREE, drm_legacy_sg_free, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
637
638 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_WAIT_VBLANK, drm_wait_vblank, DRM_UNLOCKED),
639
640 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODESET_CTL, drm_modeset_ctl, 0),
641
642 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_UPDATE_DRAW, drm_noop, DRM_AUTH|DRM_MASTER|DRM_ROOT_ONLY),
643
644 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE, drm_gem_close_ioctl, DRM_UNLOCKED|DRM_RENDER_ALLOW),
645 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GEM_FLINK, drm_gem_flink_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_UNLOCKED),
646 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_GEM_OPEN, drm_gem_open_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_UNLOCKED),

651 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_PRIME_FD_TO_HANDLE, drm_prime_fd_to_handle_ioctl, DRM_AUTH|DRM_UNLOCKED|DRM_RENDER_ALLOW),

655 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_SETCRTC, drm_mode_setcrtc, DRM_MASTER|DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),

675 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_MAP_DUMB, drm_mode_mmap_dumb_ioctl, DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),

677 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_OBJ_GETPROPERTIES, drm_mode_obj_get_properties_ioctl, DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
678 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_OBJ_SETPROPERTY, drm_mode_obj_set_property_ioctl, DRM_MASTER|DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
679 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CURSOR2, drm_mode_cursor2_ioctl, DRM_MASTER|DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
680 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_ATOMIC, drm_mode_atomic_ioctl, DRM_MASTER|DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
681 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CREATEPROPBLOB, drm_mode_createblob_ioctl, DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
682 DRM_IOCTL_DEF(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_DESTROYPROPBLOB, drm_mode_destroyblob_ioctl, DRM_CONTROL_ALLOW|DRM_UNLOCKED),
683};
684
685#define DRM_CORE_IOCTL_COUNT ARRAY_SIZE( drm_ioctls )
686
687/**
688 * drm_ioctl - ioctl callback implementation for DRM drivers
689 * @filp: file this ioctl is called on
690 * @cmd: ioctl cmd number
691 * @arg: user argument
692 *
693 * Looks up the ioctl function in the ::ioctls table, checking for root
694 * previleges if so required, and dispatches to the respective function.
695 *
696 * Returns:
697 * Zero on success, negative error code on failure.
698 */
699#ifdef __NetBSD__
700#include <sys/file.h>
701int
702drm_ioctl(struct file *fp, unsigned long cmd, void *data)
703{
704 char stackbuf[128];
705 char *buf = stackbuf;
706 void *data0 = data;
707 struct drm_file *const file = fp->f_data;
708 const unsigned int nr = DRM_IOCTL_NR(cmd);
709 int error;
710
711 switch (cmd) {
712 case FIONBIO:
713 case FIOASYNC:
714 return 0;
715 default:
716 break;
717 }
718
719 if (IOCGROUP(cmd) != DRM_IOCTL_BASE)
720 return EINVAL;
721
722 KASSERT(file != NULL);
723 KASSERT(file->minor != NULL);
724 KASSERT(file->minor->dev != NULL);
725 struct drm_device *const dev = file->minor->dev;
726 const struct drm_ioctl_desc *ioctl;
727
728 if (drm_device_is_unplugged(dev))
729 return ENXIO;
730
731 const bool is_driver_ioctl =
732 (DRM_COMMAND_BASE <= nr) && (nr < DRM_COMMAND_END);
733
734 if (is_driver_ioctl) {
735 const unsigned int driver_nr = nr - DRM_COMMAND_BASE;
736 if (driver_nr >= dev->driver->num_ioctls)
737 return EINVAL;
738 ioctl = &dev->driver->ioctls[driver_nr];
739 } else if (nr < __arraycount(drm_ioctls)) {
740 ioctl = &drm_ioctls[nr];
741 } else {
742 ioctl = NULL;
743 }
744
745 if ((ioctl == NULL) || (ioctl->func == NULL))
746 return EINVAL;
747
748 /* XXX errno Linux->NetBSD */
749 error = -drm_ioctl_permit(ioctl->flags, file);
750 if (error)
751 return error;
752
753 /* If userland passed in too few bytes, zero-pad them. */
754 if (IOCPARM_LEN(cmd) < IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd)) {
755 /* 12-bit quantity, according to <sys/ioccom.h> */
756 KASSERT(IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd) <= 4096);
757 if (IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd) > sizeof stackbuf) {
758 buf = kmem_alloc(IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd), KM_NOSLEEP);
759 if (buf == NULL)
760 return ENOMEM;
761 }
762 memcpy(buf, data, IOCPARM_LEN(cmd));
763 memset(buf + IOCPARM_LEN(cmd), 0,
764 IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd) - IOCPARM_LEN(cmd));
765 data0 = buf;
766 }
767
768 if ((drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_MODESET) && is_driver_ioctl) ||
769 ISSET(ioctl->flags, DRM_UNLOCKED)) {
770 /* XXX errno Linux->NetBSD */
771 error = -(*ioctl->func)(dev, data0, file);
772 } else {
773 mutex_lock(&drm_global_mutex);
774 /* XXX errno Linux->NetBSD */
775 error = -(*ioctl->func)(dev, data0, file);
776 mutex_unlock(&drm_global_mutex);
777 }
778
779 /* If we used a temporary buffer, copy it back out. */
780 if (data != data0)
781 memcpy(data, data0, IOCPARM_LEN(cmd));
782
783 /* If we had to allocate a heap buffer, free it. */
784 if (buf != stackbuf)
785 kmem_free(buf, IOCPARM_LEN(ioctl->cmd));
786
787 return error;
788}
789#else
790long drm_ioctl(struct file *filp,
791 unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
792{
793 struct drm_file *file_priv = filp->private_data;
794 struct drm_device *dev;
795 const struct drm_ioctl_desc *ioctl = NULL;
796 drm_ioctl_t *func;
797 unsigned int nr = DRM_IOCTL_NR(cmd);
798 int retcode = -EINVAL;
799 char stack_kdata[128];
800 char *kdata = NULL;
801 unsigned int usize, asize, drv_size;
802 bool is_driver_ioctl;
803
804 dev = file_priv->minor->dev;
805
806 if (drm_device_is_unplugged(dev))
807 return -ENODEV;
808
809 is_driver_ioctl = nr >= DRM_COMMAND_BASE && nr < DRM_COMMAND_END;
810
811 if (is_driver_ioctl) {
812 /* driver ioctl */
813 if (nr - DRM_COMMAND_BASE >= dev->driver->num_ioctls)
814 goto err_i1;
815 ioctl = &dev->driver->ioctls[nr - DRM_COMMAND_BASE];
816 } else {
817 /* core ioctl */
818 if (nr >= DRM_CORE_IOCTL_COUNT)
819 goto err_i1;
820 ioctl = &drm_ioctls[nr];
821 }
822
823 drv_size = _IOC_SIZE(ioctl->cmd);
824 usize = _IOC_SIZE(cmd);
825 asize = max(usize, drv_size);
826 cmd = ioctl->cmd;
827
828 DRM_DEBUG("pid=%d, dev=0x%lx, auth=%d, %s\n",
829 task_pid_nr(current),
830 (long)old_encode_dev(file_priv->minor->kdev->devt),
831 file_priv->authenticated, ioctl->name);
832
833 /* Do not trust userspace, use our own definition */
834 func = ioctl->func;
835
836 if (unlikely(!func)) {
837 DRM_DEBUG("no function\n");
838 retcode = -EINVAL;
839 goto err_i1;
840 }
841
842 retcode = drm_ioctl_permit(ioctl->flags, file_priv);
843 if (unlikely(retcode))
844 goto err_i1;
845
846 if (cmd & (IOC_IN | IOC_OUT)) {
847 if (asize <= sizeof(stack_kdata)) {
848 kdata = stack_kdata;
849 } else {
850 kdata = kmalloc(asize, GFP_KERNEL);
851 if (!kdata) {
852 retcode = -ENOMEM;
853 goto err_i1;
854 }
855 }
856 if (asize > usize)
857 memset(kdata + usize, 0, asize - usize);
858 }
859
860 if (cmd & IOC_IN) {
861 if (copy_from_user(kdata, (void __user *)arg,
862 usize) != 0) {
863 retcode = -EFAULT;
864 goto err_i1;
865 }
866 } else if (cmd & IOC_OUT) {
867 memset(kdata, 0, usize);
868 }
869
870 /* Enforce sane locking for kms driver ioctls. Core ioctls are
871 * too messy still. */
872 if ((drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_MODESET) && is_driver_ioctl) ||
873 (ioctl->flags & DRM_UNLOCKED))
874 retcode = func(dev, kdata, file_priv);
875 else {
876 mutex_lock(&drm_global_mutex);
877 retcode = func(dev, kdata, file_priv);
878 mutex_unlock(&drm_global_mutex);
879 }
880
881 if (cmd & IOC_OUT) {
882 if (copy_to_user((void __user *)arg, kdata,
883 usize) != 0)
884 retcode = -EFAULT;
885 }
886
887 err_i1:
888 if (!ioctl)
889 DRM_DEBUG("invalid ioctl: pid=%d, dev=0x%lx, auth=%d, cmd=0x%02x, nr=0x%02x\n",
890 task_pid_nr(current),
891 (long)old_encode_dev(file_priv->minor->kdev->devt),
892 file_priv->authenticated, cmd, nr);
893
894 if (kdata != stack_kdata)
895 kfree(kdata);
896 if (retcode)
897 DRM_DEBUG("ret = %d\n", retcode);
898 return retcode;
899}
900#endif
901EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_ioctl);
902
903/**
904 * drm_ioctl_flags - Check for core ioctl and return ioctl permission flags
905 * @nr: ioctl number
906 * @flags: where to return the ioctl permission flags
907 *
908 * This ioctl is only used by the vmwgfx driver to augment the access checks
909 * done by the drm core and insofar a pretty decent layering violation. This
910 * shouldn't be used by any drivers.
911 *
912 * Returns:
913 * True if the @nr corresponds to a DRM core ioctl numer, false otherwise.
914 */
915bool drm_ioctl_flags(unsigned int nr, unsigned int *flags)
916{
917 if (nr >= DRM_COMMAND_BASE && nr < DRM_COMMAND_END)
918 return false;
919
920 if (nr >= DRM_CORE_IOCTL_COUNT)
921 return false;
922
923 *flags = drm_ioctls[nr].flags;
924 return true;
925}
926EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_ioctl_flags);
927
